name: The Spell-Slinger
luck_special: When you spend a point of Luck, the official council of wizards is going to poke their nose into your business...

pre_moves.heading: Combat Magic
description: You have a few attack spells you can use as weapons.
When you use these spells to [[kick some ass]], roll +Weird instead of +Tough.
Sometimes the situation may require you to [[act under pressure]] to cast your spell without problems.
Your combat spells can combine any of your base spells with any of your effects.

children.heading: Combat magic, pick three (with at least one base):

options.name: Blast
options.description: 2-harm magic close obvious loud

options.name: Ball
options.description: 1-harm magic area close obvious loud

options.name: Missile
options.description: 1-harm magic far obvious loud

options.name: Wall
options.description: 1-harm magic barrier close 1-armour obvious loud

options.name: Fire
options.description: Add '+2 harm fire' to a base. If you get a 10+ on a combat magic roll, the fire won’t spread.

options.name: Force or Wind
options.description: Add '+1 harm forceful' to a base, or '+1 armour' to a wall.

options.name: Lightning or Entropy
options.description: Add '+1 harm messy' to a base.

options.name: Frost or Ice
options.description: Adds '-1 harm +2 armour' to a wall, or '+1 harm restraining' to other bases.

options.name: Earth
options.description: Add 'forceful restraining' to a base.

options.name: Necromantic
options.description: Add 'life-drain' to a base.

moves.heading: Moves
moves.description: You get all the basic moves and four Spell-slinger moves.

children.name: Tools and Techniques
children.description: To use your combat magic effectively you rely on a collection of tools and techniques. Cross off one; you’ll need the rest.

options.name: Consumables
options.description: You need certain supplies— powders, oils, etc—on hand, some will be used up each cast. If you don’t have them, take 1-harm ignore-armour when you cast.

options.name: Foci
options.description: You need wands, staves, and other obvious props to focus. If you don’t have what you need, your combat magic does 1 less harm.

options.name: Gestures
options.description: You need to wave your hands around to use combat magic. If you’re restrained, take -1 ongoing for combat magic.

options.name: Incantations
options.description: You must speak in an arcane languageto control your magic. If you use combat magic without speaking, act under pressure to avoid scrambling your thoughts.

options.name: Advanced Arcane Training
options.description: If you have two of your three Tools and Techniques at the ready, you may ignore the third one.

options.name: Arcane Reputation
options.description: Pick three big organizations or groups in the supernatural community. They’ve heard of you and respect your power. With affected humans, take +1 forward when you manipulate them. You may manipulate affected monsters as if they were human, with no bonus.

options.name: Could’ve Been Worse
options.description: When you miss a use magic roll, choose one of the following options instead of losing control of the magic: Fizzle or This Is Gonna Suck.

options.name: Enchanted Clothing
options.description: Pick an article of everyday clothing—it’s enchanted without any change in appearance. Take -1 harm from any source that tries to get at you through the garment.

options.name: Forensic Divination
options.description: When you successfully investigate a mystery, ask 'What magic was done here?' as a free extra question.

options.name: Go Big or Go Home
options.description: When you must use magic as a requirement for Big Magic, take +1 ongoing to those use magic rolls.

options.name: Not My Fault
options.description: +1 to act under pressure when dealing with the consequences of your own spell-casting.

options.name: Practitioner
options.description: Choose two effects available to you under use magic. Take +1 to use magic whenever you choose one of those effects.

options.name: Shield Spell
options.description: When you protect someone, gain 2-armour against any harm that is transferred to you. This doesn’t stack with your other armour, if any.

options.name: Third Eye
options.description: When you read a bad situation, open up your third eye for a moment to take in extra information. Take +1 hold on any result of 7 or more. You can see invisible things. On a miss, you may still get 1 hold, but you’re exposed to supernatural danger.

gear.heading: Gear
gear.description: You don’t need much—aside from any foci or consumables to power your magic. Still, it’s good to carry some backup.

introductions.heading: Introductions
description: When you get here, wait for everyone to catch up so you can do your introductions together.
Go around the group. On your turn, introduce your Spell-slinger by name and look, and tell the group what they know about you.

history.heading: History
history.description: Go around the group again. On your turn, pick one for each of the other hunters:
options: They act as your conscience when the power goes to your head. Ask them about the last time this happened.
Blood relation, though you were out of contact for years. Ask them how they reconnected with you.
Mentor from another life. Ask them what they taught you.
Your magic-fueled rescue of them introduced them to the supernatural. Tell them what creature was after them.
An old rivalry has turned into a tight friendship. Tell them what you once fought over.
You thought they were dead, and now they’re back. What “killed” them?
They’re an on-again/off-again love interest. Ask them what keeps you apart. Tell them what keeps you together.
A comrade-in-arms. You’ve faced the biggest threats together.

improvements_advanced.heading: Advanced Improvements
improvements_advanced.description: Once you’ve taken five improvements from the Improvements list, you can take one of the following advanced improvements instead of an improvement.

options.description: Get +1 to any rating, max +3
Change this hunter to a new type
Create a second hunter to play as well as this one
Mark two of the basic moves as advanced
Mark another two of the basic moves as advanced
Retire this hunter to safety
Erase one used Luck mark from your playbook
Take another Combat Magic pick
You may cross off another option from your Tools and Techniques

improvements_mythic.heading: Mythic Improvements
improvements_mythic.description: If you have taken at least twelve improvements, at your Keeper’s discretion, you can take one of the following improvements by spending more than one improvement.

options.description: Erase one used Luck mark from your playbook
Take another Spell-Slinger move.
Take another Combat Magic pick
